content.transcript:
The most common reasons for food poisoning are:
  • Food prepared too far in advance and stored at room temperature;
  • Cooling food too slowly prior to refrigeration;
  • Not cooking or reheating food to high enough temperatures to destroy food poisoning bacteria;
  • Not defrosting frozen poultry for sufficient time; and
  • Infected food handlers.

page.statement: The most common reasons for food poisoning are:
page.bullet: Food prepared too far in advance and stored at room temperature
Cooling food too slowly prior to refrigeration
Not cooking or reheating food to high enough temperatures to destroy food poisoning bacteria
Not defrosting frozen poultry for sufficient time
